recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
directions: Step 1: Put a large saucepan of water on to boil.
Step 2: Finely chop the pancetta, having first removed any rind.
Step 3: Finely grate both cheeses and mix them together.
Step 4: Beat the eggs in a medium bowl, season with a little freshly grated black pepper and set everything aside.
Step 5: Add 1 tsp salt to the boiling water, add the spaghetti and when the water comes back to the boil, cook at a constant simmer, covered, for 10 minutes or until al dente.
Step 6: Squash the garlic with the blade of a knife, just to bruise it.
Step 7: While the spaghetti is cooking, fry the pancetta with the garlic. Drop the butter into a large frying pan or wok and, as soon as the butter has melted, tip in the pancetta and garlic.

Step 8: Leave to cook on a medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until the pancetta is golden and crisp. The garlic has now imparted its flavour, so take it out with a slotted spoon and discard.

Step 9: Keep the heat under the pancetta on low. When the pasta is ready, lift it from the water with a pasta fork or tongs and put it in the frying pan with the pancetta. Don’t worry if a little water drops in the pan (you want this to happen) and don’t throw away the pasta water yet.
Step 10: Mix most of the cheese in with the eggs, keeping a small handful back for sprinkling over later.

Step 11: Take the pan of spaghetti and pancetta off the heat. Quickly pour in the eggs and cheese. Using the tongs or a long fork, lift up the spaghetti so it mixes easily with the egg mixture, which thickens but doesn’t scramble, and everything is coated.
Step 12: Add extra pasta cooking water to keep it saucy (several tablespoons should do it). You don’t want it wet, just moist. Season with a little salt, if needed.
Step 13: Use a long-pronged fork to twist the pasta on to the serving plate or bowl. Serve immediately with a little sprinkling of the remaining cheese and a grating of black pepper.

recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
directions: Step 1: Cook the fettuccine according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Step 2: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Step 3: Add the chicken strips and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 4: Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1 minute until fragrant.
Step 5: Reduce the heat to medium and pour in the heavy cream. Bring to a simmer.
Step 6: Gradually stir in the grated Parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth and thickened.
Step 7: Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 8: Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to coat with the Alfredo sauce.
Step 9: Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired, and serve immediately.
